words.definition: To abuse is to use something for the wrong purpose.
words.example: The man abused his power and took people's money.

words.definition: To afford means to have enough money to pay for something.
words.example: I cannot afford to buy a new car.

words.definition: To bake means to cook food with dry heat, usually in an oven.
words.example: My grandmother is baking a cake for my birthday.

words.definition: A bean is a seed from a plant that can be eaten.
words.example: I like to eat beans with my rice.

words.definition: A candle is a stick of wax that burns to give light.
words.example: I used a candle when the lights went out.

words.definition: To convert something is to change it into something else.
words.example: The man converted his garage into a room.

words.definition: A debt is an amount of money that you owe someone.
words.example: I have a lot of debt because of my student loans.

words.definition: To decrease is to make something less or smaller.
words.example: The population of the town has decreased over the years.

words.definition: A fault is a mistake.
words.example: It was my fault that the vase broke.

words.definition: A fund is an amount of money that is kept for a special purpose.
words.example: We have a fund to pay for our daughter's college.

words.definition: A generous person is someone who likes to give things to others.
words.example: The man was very generous and gave money to the poor.

words.definition: An ingredient is something that is used to make food.
words.example: The main ingredient in the soup is chicken.

words.definition: To insist is to be firm about something.
words.example: I insist that you stay for dinner.

words.definition: A mess is a condition that is untidy or dirty.
words.example: The house was a mess after the party.

words.definition: Metal is a hard substance like iron or gold.
words.example: The key is made of metal.

words.definition: To monitor is to watch something carefully.
words.example: The teacher monitors the students during the test.

words.definition: To oppose is to be against something or someone.
words.example: Many people oppose the new law.

words.definition: A passive person does not take action or give energy to things.
words.example: The boy was passive during the game and did not play hard.

words.definition: A quantity is an amount of something.
words.example: I have a large quantity of books in my room.

words.definition: To sue is to take someone to court.
words.example: He sued the company for the accident.
